content.title: Intermittent Deprecation Warning on Import in Google App Engine #815
content.layoutDescription: Web page layout with text and profile image
content.visibleText:
burnash / gspread

Code Issues 41 Pull requests 9 Actions Projects Wiki Security Insights

Intermittent Deprecation Warning on Import in Google App Engine #815
Closed amanda-ruby opened this issue on Sep 29, 2020 · 2 comments

amanda-ruby commented on Sep 29, 2020 · edited

Describe the bug
Intermittently, import of gspread in a GAE application is producing the following warning: /env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/gspread/auth.py: 38: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \g
Why it is intermittent is so far unclear.

To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Run an application with gspread in GAE.
2. Wait.

Expected behavior
No deprecation warning.

Code example*
Around line 38 in gspread's auth.py, there's a comment that contains the implicated \g character.

Menu bar with File, Edit, Selection, View, Go, Run, Terminal, Help; Sidebar with Explorer, Search, Source Control, Run and Debug, Extensions; Status bar at bottom

content.title: gsheets.py
content.visibleText:
import gspread
from oauth2client.service_account import ServiceAccountCredentials
from google.oauth2.service_account import Credentials

# Set up the credentials
def authenticate_gspread(json_credentials):
 scope = [
 'https://www.googleapis.com/auth/spreadsheets',
 'https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive'
 ]
 sa_credentials = Credentials.from_service_account_info(json_credentials, scopes=scope)
 client = gspread.authorize(sa_credentials)
 return client
